results.title: Touch the Sun : Top enders (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Jill Robb and Jackie McKimmie
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Alice, a runaway from home, meets on the road Nick, an Aboriginal boy in pursuit of his uncle. Stealing a car they traverse a treacherous stretch of desert road. When the car runs out of petrol they set out on foot, only to become lost. With the harsh desert conditions threatening their survival, Alice and Mick reflect on their actions and their families from which they have fled.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Children’s Television Foundation, Jill Robb and Jackie McKimmie

results.title: Touch the Sun : Princess Kate
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation and George Ogilvie
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Thirteen year old Kate’s world is turned topsy turvy when she learns she is adopted. Unaware of the pain she is causing her adoptive family, Kate searches for her “real” parents. Her unexpected arrival on the doorstep of her natural mother stirs up mixed emotions. Kate succeeds in befriending her half-sister May before returning home to her adoptive parents with a new understanding of herself and her relationships. Rated: G

results.title: Touch the Sun : Devil's Hill (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jill Robb, Australian Children's Television Foundation and Esben Storm
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Badge, a young boy, lives with his parents on a struggling farm in the Tasmanian bush. When Badge’s city cousins come to stay he finds their brash opinions unsettling. Following a violent storm the farm’s viability is threatened by the death of one cow and the escape of another. The children’s quest to recapture the cow leads them to the mysterious crag, Devil’s Hill. In conquering the perils of the mountain the children set aside their bickering and discover the value of co-operation. Rated: G
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jill Robb, Australian Children’s Television Foundation and Esben Storm

results.title: Touch the Sun : The Gift (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Tony Llewellyn-Jones and Paul Cox
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Nicos and Sofia, two city kids, strike it lucky in a lottery. Their prize is five hundred hectares of beautiful bushland in Western Australia. Together with their grandfather the children travel West to discover the mystery and magic of their land. However the children discover a darker side to their new found fortune.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Children’s Television Foundation, Tony Llewellyn-Jones and Paul Cox

results.title: Touch the Sun : Peter and Pompey (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Margot McDonald and Michael Carson
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
When three children from a small coastal town find Latin inscriptions on the walls of a local cave it leads to the discovery of an authentic Roman boat. News of the find throws the town into turmoil. The town’s people rush to implement crass commercial schemes to exploit the Roman boat’s tourist potential. Angered by the way the boat’s discovery has disrupted their lives the children devise a way to restore the town to normal.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Children’s Television Foundation, Margot McDonald and Michael Carson

results.title: Touch the Sun : Captain Johnno
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Jane Ballantyne and Mario Andreacchio
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Johnno, an energetic and sensitive 10 year old, resides in a small coastal fishing town. His father’s inability to come to terms with Johnno’s deafness exacerbates their already troubled relationship. To curb Johnno’s rebelliousness, his father proposes to send him to a “special school”. On learning of this plan Johnno flees to a nearby island to live like Robinson Crusoe. An Italian fisherman, who has earlier befriended Johnno, finds him on the island and endeavours to persuade him to return and face his problems. Cast includes: Damien Walters - Captain Johnno Rebecca Sykes - Julie Michelle Fawdon - Kathleen Joe Petruzzi - Tony Written by Rob George, music by Stephen Matters. Rated G.

results.title: Touch the Sun: Devil's Hill
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Revcom Television, Jill Robb and Esben Storm
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Sam and his sisters come to stay on their cousin’s remote farm in Tasmania. Badge, the farm boy, feels daunted by the arrival of his arrogant city cousins. After a huge violent storm, the prize cow escapes. The children decide to search the mountainous wilderness for the cow and their route leads up to the mysterious Devil’s Hill. The adventure teaches them they must stick together to survive. Based on the novel by Nan Chauncy.
Cast includes Peter Hehir, Mary Haire, John Flaus, Alexander Jacobs, Emma Pugh, Cameron Atkins and Jane McArthur.

results.title: Touch the Sun : The Gift
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Tony Llewellyn-Jones and Paul Cox
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Nicos and Sofia, two city kids, strike it lucky in a lottery. Their prize is five hundred hectares of beautiful bushland in Western Australia. Together with their grandfather the children travel West to discover the mystery and magic of their land not expecting to discover a darker side to their new found fortune.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Children’s Television Foundation, Tony Llewellyn-Jones and Paul Cox
